title: Drawing, 1892
medium: Brush and watercolor, white gouache, graphite on gray wove paper
markings:
Stamped on recto, lower right: Museum for the Arts of Decoration Cooper Union [Lugt 457d]

Embossed water mark-reverse right edge: "Montgolfier a St. Marcel-Les-Anno..."
signed: Signed with initials in graphite, lower left: TM ; and with monogram in ink, lower right: TM
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, upper left:"Toltec Gorge & Eva Cliff/from the West"
description: Under a heavy grey sky, a deep chasm opens to a jagged cliff amid dark outcroppings, while touches of white punctuate a distant mountain.

exhibitions.title: Frederic Church, Winslow Homer & Thomas Moran: Tourism and the American Landscape

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, 1892.
1892. Brush and watercolor, white gouache, graphite on gray wove paper. Gift of Thomas Moran. 1917-17-31.
